description: Number of planar hexagon trees with n hexagons.
references: L. W. Beineke and R. E. Pippert, On the enumeration of planar trees of hexagons, Glasgow Math. J., 15 (1974), 131-147.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: Index entries for sequences related to trees
formula: See Theorem 3 on p. 142 in the Beineke-Pippert paper; also the Maple and Mathematica codes here.a(n) ~ 5^(5*n + 1/2) / (sqrt(Pi) * n^(5/2) * 2^(8*n + 13/2)). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Mar 13 2016
maple: T := proc(n) if floor(n)=n then binomial(5*n+1,n)/(5*n+1) else 0 fi end: U := proc(n) if n mod 2 = 0 then binomial(5*n/2+1, n/2)/(5*n/2+1) else 6*binomial((5*n+1)/2,(n-1)/2)/(5*n+1) fi end: S := n->T(n)/4/(2*n+1)+T(n/2)/6+(5*n-2)*T((n-1)/3)/6/(2*n+1)+T((n-1)/6)/6+7*U(n)/12: seq(S(n),n=1..25); (Emeric Deutsch)
mathematica: p=6; Table[(Binomial[(p-1)n, n]/(((p-2)n+1)((p-2)n+2)) + If[OddQ[n], If[OddQ[p], Binomial[(p-1)n/2, (n-1)/2]/n, (p+1)Binomial[((p-1)n-1)/2, (n-1)/2]/((p-2)n+2)], 3Binomial[(p-1)n/2, n/2]/((p-2)n+2)]+Plus @@ Map[EulerPhi[ # ]Binomial[((p-1)n+1)/#, (n-1)/# ]/((p-1)n+1)&, Complement[Divisors[GCD[p, n-1]], {1, 2}]])/2, {n, 1, 20}] - _Robert A. Russell_, Dec 11 2004
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
